ResourceHeader.Description: Wind MFI composite data. The files contain multiple time resolution data: 3-second, 1-minute, and 1-hour. Data come in either version 3 or version 4 with version 4 preferred when available. Both are calibrated science quality data, however, the version 4 data has a small, final correction applied to the Bz component which is not found in the version 3 data. Details of this correction can be found in the caveats section of this document. The version 4 correction is a manual correction for long term drifts which can not be applied upon first release of the data. Thus, version 3 files are released to within a few days of the present to allow quick access to the data. Subsequently, the manual corrections are applied and version 3 files are replaced with a corresponding version 4 file. Multi-resolution data are available in CDF for ftp downloads from Wind and SPDF sites and with subset, plot and list capabilities from Wind and CDAWeb. Single resolution data (3s or 1m or 1h) are available in ASCII for ftp downloads from SPDF.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: User will acknowledge the Wind MFI instrument team, and the site from which data are pulled, in any publication resulting from the use of these data.

InformationURL.Name: Wind Spacecraft Homepage
InformationURL.Description: A web site hosting instrument information as well as web utilities for plotting and downloading data

AccessURL.Name: Via ftp in CDF from Wind site
AccessURL.Description: For ftp downloads of CDF formatted data from Wind site

AccessURL.Name: Subset, plot, list from Wind site
AccessURL.Description: Interactive interface for subsets, plots and lists of MFI and SWE data

AccessURL.Name: FTP access to files at SPDF
AccessURL.Description: For ftp downloads of CDF formatted data from SPDF

AccessURL.Name: HTTP access to files at SPDF
AccessURL.Description: In CDF via HTTP from SPDF

AccessURL.Name: CDAWeb
AccessURL.Description: CDAWeb interactive interface for subsets, plots and lists of MFI data

NumericalData.Caveats: Version 3 and 4 data are both science quality data. However, version 4 files contain a final Bz correction not found in the version 3 files. The correction is on the order of 0.1 nT and is applied manually after release of the initial version 3 data. The generation of the version 4 files requires many months of data prior to and after the corrected time periods. Thus it will always significantly lag the release of the version 3 files. When version 4 files become available the corresponding version 3 file is removed and the version 4 file becomes the only file available for that time period

Parameter.Name: Time Line (1 min)
Parameter.Description: Number of milliseconds since the epoch 1994-11-12T00:00:00.000

Parameter.Name: Time Line (1 min)
Parameter.Description: Time of observation in year, day of year, and milliseconds (1 min)

Parameter.Name: Number of points in average (1 min)
Parameter.Description: Number of data points in one-minute average

Parameter.Name: Magnetic field magnitude (1 min)
Parameter.Description: Average of the magnetic field magnitudes (F1)
Parameter.Caveats: This parameter is an average of high-time-resolution field magnitudes

Parameter.Name: Magnetic field magnitude's RMS (1 min)
Parameter.Description: RMS (standard deviation) of the average of the magnitudes (F1 RMS)

Parameter.Name: Magnetic field vector in GSM coordinates (1 min)
Parameter.Description: Average (1 min) magnetic field vector in GSM coordinates

Parameter.Name: RMS vector in GSM coordinates (1 min)
Parameter.Description: RMS mangetic field vector in GSM coordinates

Parameter.Name: Magnetic field vector in GSE coordinates (1 min)
Parameter.Description: Average (1 min) magnetic field vector in GSE coordinates

Parameter.Name: RMS vector in GSE coordinates (1 min)
Parameter.Description: RMS mangetic field vector in GSE coordinates

Parameter.Name: Radial distance (1 min)
Parameter.Description: Distance from the center of the Earth (Define Re=6378 km)

Parameter.Name: Position in GSM coordinates (1 min)
Parameter.Description: Position vector in GSM coordinates (Define Re=6378 km)

Parameter.Name: Position in GSE coordinates (1 min)
Parameter.Description: Position vector in GSE coordinates (Define Re=6378 km)

Parameter.Name: Unit spin vector in GSM coordinates (1 min)
Parameter.Description: Unit spin vector in GSM coordinates

Parameter.Name: Unit spin vector in GSE coordinates (1 min)
Parameter.Description: Unit spin vector in GSE coordinates

Parameter.Name: Delta B (Outer - Inner) (1 min)
Parameter.Description: Difference between outboard and inboard measured magnetic fields, Bouter - Binner (nT) in spacecraft coordinates.
Parameter.Caveats: Contains meaningful data only in 1:1 mode (see MAG_MODE).

Parameter.Name: Dipole tilt angle (degrees) (1 min)
Parameter.Description: Dipole tilt angle (degrees)

Parameter.Name: Average range inner magnetometer (1 min)
Parameter.Description: Average range status of the inner magnetometer (1 min)

Parameter.Name: Average range outer magnetometer (1 min)
Parameter.Description: Average range status of the outer magnetometer (1 min)

Parameter.Name: S/C operational mode (1 min)
Parameter.Description:
Spacecraft operational mode (1 min)
1 - Science mode with normal telemetry rate (92 sec major frame) 3 - Maneuver mode normal telemetry rate - no useful data 4 - Contingency mode normal telemetry rate - no useful data 5 - Science mode with double telemetry rate (46 sec major frame) 7 - Maneuver mode double telemetry rate - no useful data 8 - Contingency mode double telemetry rate - no useful data

Parameter.Name: Wind/MFI operational mode (1 min)
Parameter.Description:
Wind/MFI instrument operational mode (1 min)
0 - Primary to Secondary mag data collection rate ratio (1:1), Outboard mag primary with FFT & Snapshot data 1 - Primary to Secondary Ratio (20:1), Outboard primary with FFT & Snapshot 2 - Primary to Secondary Ratio (20:1), Outboard primary with Snapshot only 3 - Primary to Secondary Ratio (1:1), Outboard primary, Maneuver mode - no useful data 7 - Primary to Secondary Ratio (1:1), Outboard primary but used Inboard data for processing 10 - Primary to Secondary Ratio (1:1), Inboard primary with FFT & Snapshot 11 - Primary to Secondary Ratio (20:1), Inboard primary with FFT & Snapshot 12 - Primary to Secondary Ratio (20:1), Inboard primary with Snapshot only 13 - Primary to Secondary Ratio (1:1), Inboard primary, Maneuver mode - no useful data

Parameter.Name: Sensor zeros (inner)
Parameter.Description:
Inboard sensor zero computed once a day. The count-to-nT conversion formula:
B(nT) = SENS * (B(counts) - ZERO) / AMPL

Structure.Description: The 3 rows are for magnetic field components and 8 columns for sensor zeros for different sensor ranges. Current range is specified in RANGE_I.

Parameter.Name: Sensor sensitivities (inner)
Parameter.Description:
Inboard sensor sensitivity computed once a day. The count-to-nT conversion formula:
B(nT) = SENS * (B(counts) - ZERO) / AMPL

Structure.Description: The 3 rows are for magnetic field components and 8 columns for sensor zeros for different sensor ranges. Current range is specified in RANGE_I.

Parameter.Name: Amplitude correction (inner)
Parameter.Description:
Inboard sensor conversion amplitude computed once a day. The count-to-nT conversion formula:
B(nT) = SENS * (B(counts) - ZERO) / AMPL

Structure.Description: The 3 rows are for magnetic field components and 8 columns for sensor zeros for different sensor ranges. Current range is specified in RANGE_I.

Parameter.Name: Orthogonalization matrix (inner)
Parameter.Description: Orthogonalization matrix (inner magnetometer)

Parameter.Name: Payload rotation matrix (inner)
Parameter.Description: Payload rotation matrix (inner magnetometer)

Parameter.Name: Sensor zero flag (inner)
Parameter.Description: Sensor zero flag (inner magnetometer): 1 - No calibration data for day, used last available calibration 2 - Daily calibration value used (version 3 file) 3 - Daily calibration value used with updated Z correction (version 4 file)

Parameter.Name: Sensor zeros (outer)
Parameter.Description:
Outboard sensor zero computed once a day. The count-to-nT conversion formula:
B(nT) = SENS * (B(counts) - ZERO) / AMPL

Structure.Description: The 3 rows are for magnetic field components and 8 columns for sensor zeros for different sensor ranges. Current range is specified in RANGE_O.
